result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven J Cynova was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Fail/Comply-Officer/Person into Custody, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.415(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.  Bail to apply.
**Restitution set at zero.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to count two, and concurrent to case 14CM1978.  Credit for 14 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Comply with the standard rules of Extended Supervision.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment. Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended ad may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one, and concurrent with case 14CM1978.  Credit for 14 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Conditions as listed on count one.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (45 pages) commencing 02/16/2015 PLEA/ SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.
Bail Refund Check Packet
BAIL REFUND NOTICE/AFFIDAVIT MAILED TO SURETY.
Letter from attorney requesting bail money be returned to his office.
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Steven J Cynova in court with attorney Michael S. Winter.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. No changes made to the PSI. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements made by defendant's wife, Trina C.

AS TO COUNT 1:    The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 42 MONTHS, concurrent to Count 2, and concurrent to case# 14CM1978.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 MONTHS.
Credit for 14 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 36 MONTHS, concurrent to Count 1, and concurrent to case# 14CM1978.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 12 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 MONTHS.
Credit for 14 days time served.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victims.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY .
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
* Court ordered $3,000.00 of the cash bail on deposit to be assigned to Attorney Michael S. Winter for defendant's attorney fees.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

with attached Addendum of letters received by the defendant.
for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI); signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to the Probation Department for processing.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report; filed.

Defendant Steven J Cynova in court with attorney Michael S. Winter.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court AMENDED the charges as follows:   

Count 1:  2nd Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety by Use of a Dangerous Weapon [a Class G FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 941.30(2), 939.50(3)(g), 939.63(1)(b). 
Count 2:  Failure to Comply with Officer's Attempt to Take Person Into Custody [a Class I FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 946.415(2), 939.50(3)(i).

(Count #s 3 and 4 are not processed.)

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2 (AMENDED):    Defendant pled GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

**Upon defense request, Court ordered a PSI with a recommendation.

Case adjourned to 01-29-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

Bail and conditions of bail release remain the same.

Court will accept case# 14CM1978 from Judge Protasiewicz's Court for purposes of a global resolution only.
